titleStmt.title: 71 - The Returned Volunteer to his Rifle

body.p: The Returned Volunteer to his Rifle

Over the hearth—my father's seat— Repose, to patriot-memory dear, Thou tried companion, whom at last I greet By steepy banks of Hudson here. How oft I told thee of this scene— The Highlands[allusion] [place] The mountains on either side of the Hudson River in New York. (Eric Meckley) blue—the river's narrowing sheen. Little at Gettysburg we thought To find such haven; but God kept it green. Long rest! with belt, and bayonet, and canteen.
